benchmark_details.name: MCPMark (A Benchmark for Stress-Testing Realistic and Comprehensive MCP Use)
benchmark_details.overview: MCPMark is a benchmark designed to evaluate Model Context Protocol (MCP) use in a more realistic and comprehensive manner, consisting of 127 high-quality tasks that require complex interactions with various environments, aiming to stress-test the capabilities of language models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation of large language models in real-world scenarios using the Model Context Protocol.
tasks: CRUD operations across various workflows in MCP environments
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: High difficulty of tasks may limit utility for evaluating smaller models.

data.source: Collaboratively created tasks by domain experts and AI agents.
data.annotation: Collaboratively annotated by experts and AI agents.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on task completion success rates across multiple runs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in Pass metrics indicate better agent performance across tasks.
methodology.validation: Tasks are validated through automated verification scripts.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Initial environments and tasks were created with appropriate licenses and ethical considerations.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Tasks and initial states comply with licensing requirements.
